p: The three main types of viruses that are known to affect asthma are HRV, RSV, and influenza. The peak periods of viral infection tend to vary from year to year, but generally in North America rhinovirus peaks in the fall and early spring, influenza in the early winter, and RSV in midwinter (Fig. 2). Many communities can monitor the progress of these annual epidemics with viral culture and molecular diagnostics, thereby giving physicians a higher probability of knowing in advance what virus a patient may have. A molecular diagnostic panel is commercially available for identifying acute viral respiratory infection, though the cost-effectiveness of this type of testing for routine clinical use is yet to be determined.
